requisition-id.name: requisition-id
requisition-id.description: The unique Requisition identifier. This can either be a workday id (WID), or a reference id in the form of "<identifier-type>=<identifier>" - for example, "Requisition_Number=REQ-1234".

requisitionLine-id.name: requisitionLine-id
requisitionLine-id.description: The unique Requisition Line identifier. This has to be a workday id (WID).

limit.name: limit
limit.description: The maximum number of items to return in a single response.

offset.name: offset
offset.description: The index of the first item to return.

get.description: Get all requisitions within the collection. Optionally, you can filter the requisitions by one or more of the parameters defined.

parameters.name: submittedBy
parameters.description: Filter requisitions by submitted Worker. Expects the workday id or the reference id of the worker.

parameters.name: submittedByPerson
parameters.description: Filter requisitions by submitted Person. Expects the workday id or the reference id of the person.

parameters.name: submittedBySupplier
parameters.description: Filter requisitions by submitted Supplier. Expects the workday id or the reference id of the supplier.

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: Filter requisitions with document date after the date specified.

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: Filter requisitions with document date on or before the date specified.

201.description: Creation is successful. Returns the requisition created.

400.description:
- Requester is required.
- Company is required to have a value.
- Currency is required.
- Ship-To Address is required.
- Quantity is required and cannot be negative.
- Spend Category is required on al requisition lines
- Unit of Measure is required on all Item Requisition Lines
- Requisition Line is required.
- The specified Item is invalid.
- The total extended amount of all lines must be greater than zero.
- The specified requester is not valid.
- Company is not active.
- Unit Cost is required.

patch.description: Edits details about a requisition's header attributes

parameters.name: requisitionBody
parameters.description: Header details to be edited for the requisition.

200.description: Information about the requisition after patch operation.

400.description:
- The specified Requisition Type is invalid.
- The specified Sourcing Buyer not an active worker with access to the Sourcing domain.

get.description: Get all requisition lines for the requisition

post.description: Create a new requisition line for requisition. Note that this operation has Bulk support. if "bulk=true" is passed in through query parameter, then an array of requisition line is expected, under the "data" element. Each requisition line entry in the array will end up creating a new requisition line for the requisition. The maximum size of the array is 20.

parameters.name: requisitionLineBody
parameters.description: Details for the new requisition line. This is for the case for non-bulk case.

201.description: Creation is successful. Returns the requisition line created.

400.description:
- Quantity is required and cannot be negative.
- Spend Category is required on all requisition lines
- Unit of Measure is required on all Item Requisition Lines
- The specified Item is invalid.
- The total extended amount of all lines must be greater than zero.
- Unit Cost is required.

get.description: Get specific requisition line for the requisition

parameters.name: requisitionLineBody
parameters.description: Line details to be edited for the specified requisition line. Note that bulk processing is also supported. This is done by specifying "bulk=true" in the query string. In that case, the parameter "{requisitionLine-id}" is no longer mentioned in the URL itself, instead, it'll be mentioned in the body, identified by attribute named "id". In the body an array of requisition line is expected, under the "data" element. Each requisition line entry in the array will end up editing the corresponding the requisition line (identified by the attribute named "id"). The maximum size of the array is 20.

200.description: Returns a reference to the requisition line that was edited

400.description:
- Item line's quantity must be greater than or equal to 1.
- Item line's requested delivery date must to be later than or equal to requested date or current date.
- Service line's start date must to be later than or equal to requested date or current date.
- Service line's end date must to be later than or equal to start date.

get.description: Get related purchase orders for the requisition.

200.description: Information about the purchase orders for the requisition.

post.description: Create a requisition approval event. This is equivalent to submitting a requisition for approval.

parameters.name: requisitionBody
parameters.description: Empty body for requisition approval creation event

201.description: Returns a reference to the requisition that was edited

400.description: - You cannot submit this requisition. Either the requisition is not in submittable status, or you are not authorized to submit this requisition.

post.description: Create a new attachment for requisition.

201.description: Returns a reference to the attachment that was created

get.description: Get all attachments for the requisition. Note that this operation will only return metadata. This cannot be used to get binary file content.

200.description: Information about the attachments for the requisition.

patch.description: Update metadata for a specific attachment for requisition, such as comment and external attachment indicator

200.description: Returns a reference to the attachment that was edited

get.description: Get attachment information. Note that this operation can return either the metadata of the attachment, or the binary content of the attachment. The difference is based on whether the query parameter type is specified.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: if this parameter is passed with value "getFileContent", the response will be the binary file content instead.

200.description: Information about the attachments for the requisition.

201.description: - Returns a reference to the requisition that was canceled.

400.description: - Cancel was unsuccessful. Reason for not being able to cancel will be returned.

endDate.description: End date of service requisition lines.
